ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: If one is interested in military power, strategy, tactics, and the overall use of the military as a political tool--take this class. It was great from top to bottom.

I would strongly reccomend the course to another student. Many works are oft cited, and little read. If you are going to do anything in the discipline which deals with the use of military force in either comparative politics or international relations, you should take this class, and read these works before citing them. Additionally, it will help both with thinking about theory and writing clearly, two critical tasks to writing a dissertation.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course gave me a deeper critical understanding of how we conceptualize military force, something which is of use for my thinking about the use of violence to accomplish political goals. It improved my writing skills, as well as thinking in complex terms, rather than simply saying 'X causes Y'. It provided a number of interesting puzzles, some of which hopefully will make it into either articles, or else provide a clearer framing for my dissertation project.
